page.title: 01Introduction and Gazetteer
page.content: The area in{Hampshire}covered by this part of the{Domesday Survey} reaches from the eastern side of {Alton}to the west of the block, through the picturesque village of {Holybourne}to the north to the small village of{East Worldham}to the south-east. The area is one of particular beauty and interest, with many historical features. Of especial interest to the visitor to the area could be the village of{Holybourne} with its many old and beautiful buildings, not least being the historic Georgian{Andrews' Endowed {School,}founded in 1719, and{The Lawn, home of the writer{Elizabeth Gaskell.} Also of interest is the Alton terminal and British Rail interchange for the privately-run{Watercress Line steam railway which runs to Alresford.
